SEARCH
Package com.app.controller

Class UserController

java.lang.Object
com.app.controller.UserController
@RestController @RequestMapping("/users") public class UserController extends Object
Controller for handling user-related operations such as registration, activation, login, password reset, email change, role change, and token management.

This class provides endpoints for managing users and authentication tasks like creating, activating, and refreshing users, as well as managing passwords and roles.

  • Method Details

    • createUser

      @PostMapping("/login") @ResponseStatus(CREATED) public ResponseDto<Long> createUser(@RequestBody CreateUserDto user)
      Creates a new user account.

      This endpoint allows the creation of a new user by accepting the user's information.

      Parameters:
      user - the details of the user to be created.
      Returns:
      a ResponseDto containing the ID of the created user.

    • activateUser

      @PostMapping("/login/activate") @ResponseStatus(OK) public ResponseDto<Long> activateUser(@RequestBody UserTokenActivationDto userTokenActivationDto)
      Activates a user account using a token.

      This endpoint activates a user by providing the activation token.

      Parameters:
      userTokenActivationDto - the activation token details for the user.
      Returns:
      a ResponseDto containing the ID of the activated user.

    • refreshActivate

      @PostMapping("/login/mail/refresh") @ResponseStatus(OK) public ResponseDto<Long> refreshActivate(@RequestBody UserEmailRefreshToken userTokenActivationDto)
      Refreshes the activation token for the user via email.

      This endpoint sends a new activation token to the user's email for account activation.

      Parameters:
      userTokenActivationDto - the email details for refreshing the token.
      Returns:
      a ResponseDto containing the ID of the user whose token is refreshed.

    • refreshUser

      @PostMapping("/login/refresh") @ResponseStatus(OK) public ResponseDto<TokensDto> refreshUser(@RequestBody RefreshTokenDto refreshTokenDto)
      Refreshes the user's access token.

      This endpoint refreshes the user's session by accepting the refresh token and issuing a new pair of access and refresh tokens.

      Parameters:
      refreshTokenDto - the details of the refresh token.
      Returns:
      a ResponseDto containing the new TokensDto (access and refresh tokens).

    • lostPassword

      @PostMapping("/login/lost") @ResponseStatus(OK) public ResponseDto<Long> lostPassword(@Valid @RequestBody @Valid EmailDto emailDto, org.springframework.validation.BindingResult bindingResult)
      Initiates the password reset process by sending a reset link to the provided email.

      This endpoint allows the user to request a password reset by providing their email.

      Parameters:
      emailDto - the email address of the user who lost their password.
      bindingResult - holds validation errors, if any.
      Returns:
      a ResponseDto containing the ID of the user requesting password reset.
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if validation errors are found.

    • newPassword

      @PatchMapping("/login/password") @ResponseStatus(OK) public ResponseDto<Long> newPassword(@RequestBody NewPasswordDto newPasswordDto)
      Allows the user to set a new password.

      This endpoint allows the user to reset their password using the new password provided.

      Parameters:
      newPasswordDto - the new password details.
      Returns:
      a ResponseDto containing the ID of the user whose password has been changed.

    • changeEmail

      @PatchMapping("/email") @ResponseStatus(OK) public ResponseDto<Long> changeEmail(@RequestBody EmailDto emailDto, @RequestHeader(name="Authorization") String token)
      Changes the user's email address.

      This endpoint allows the user to change their email address after providing the new email and a valid authorization token.

      Parameters:
      emailDto - the new email details.
      token - the authorization token for the user.
      Returns:
      a ResponseDto containing the ID of the user whose email was changed.

    • changePassword

      @PatchMapping("/password") @ResponseStatus(OK) public ResponseDto<Long> changePassword(@RequestBody ChangePasswordDto changePasswordDto, @RequestHeader(name="Authorization") String token)
      Changes the user's password.

      This endpoint allows the user to change their password after providing the current and new password along with a valid authorization token.

      Parameters:
      changePasswordDto - the details of the current and new password.
      token - the authorization token for the user.
      Returns:
      a ResponseDto containing the ID of the user whose password was changed.

    • changeRole

      @PatchMapping("/role") @ResponseStatus(OK) public ResponseDto<Long> changeRole(@RequestBody ChangeRoleDto changeRoleDto)
      Changes the user's role.

      This endpoint allows an administrator to change the role of a user.

      Parameters:
      changeRoleDto - the details of the role change request.
      Returns:
      a ResponseDto containing the ID of the user whose role was changed.
